result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Nicole Elizabeth Steltz in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan and Atty Jaclyn Shelton.  Gordon F Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; Court holds initial appearance, waiver of prelim and arraignment in 15CF282; in all matters Court reviews chgs and pens; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF24, 25 & 282 and count 1 of 15CM10 & 44; Court finds def f&v waives rights; Court accepts pleas withholds finding of  guilt in the felony counts and finds defendant guily of misd counts and orders all other counts including 15CF26 & 15CM44 and uncharged  read in of 15DD1217 are all dismissed and read in; victim makes statement; parties heard; defendant waives statement; Court heard and places def on TAD DPA in 15CF24, 25 & 282 and orders sentencing in 15CM10 & 44 stayed for 10 months; 

Court sets bond in 15CF282:

$1000 PA bond 
no contact w/Cheryl Levandoski; Court will allow contact for any exchange of child only and any communication will only be regarding exchange of child

Any other cash bonds shall be amended to PA bonds with same conditions
Defendant in custody - Notice sent to DCDF

15CF24,15CF25,15CF26, 15CM10,15CM44 & 15CM229 - Defendant Nicole Elizabeth Steltz in court, in custody with attorney Greg Vollan and Jaclyn Shelton.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sempf request TSC in 30 days to review new charges that may be filed.  Court grants.

w/15CF24, 25, 26, 15CM10 & 44:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims listed in 15CF24, 15CF25, 15CF26.  Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $200 by next court date.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(1:12) 15CF24, 25, 26, 15CM10, 15CM44 & 15CM229: Defendant Nicole Elizabeth Steltz in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn Shelton; Intern Kevin Schmit (Thompson) appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Initial conducted in 15CM229, Atty. Shelton states that jail never gave them copy of complaint, but will proceed with initial; Def. stands mute; Court enters NG plea on behalf; State heard on bond for all cases - $5,000 Cash; Atty. Shelton heard on FTA; Court orders: $5,000 CASH BOND: same prior conditions;   Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $200.00 prior to release.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Court orders 15CM229 to track with other cases; P&S reset 7/14/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 4
Def FTA, state requests a warrant, court finds probable cause, issues warrant.
